intro: Cyrtandra lysiosepala var. haleakalensis, commonly known as Haleakalā Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
